transportAdvice: Philadelphia has an extensive public transit network including subway, elevated rail, buses, and trolleys that connect most tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The historic center and Old City neighborhoods are very walkable, and taxis as well as rideshare vehicles are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold winter month with occasional snow and freezing temperatures; pack warm layers and waterproof footwear.
Still cold with a mix of rain and snow possible; conditions begin to slowly improve toward month's end.
Early spring brings variable weather with cool days and chilly nights; a light jacket is essential.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming trees and mild temperatures, though showers are common.
Warm and comfortable with longer days; one of the best months to explore the city on foot.
Warm to hot with rising humidity; afternoon thunderstorms are possible but outdoor activities are still enjoyable.
The hottest month of the year with high humidity; stay hydrated and plan indoor activities during peak afternoon heat.
Hot and humid similar to July; thunderstorms can occur but the city remains lively with summer events.
Temperatures begin to ease into a comfortable fall range; a great month for sightseeing with fewer crowds.
Crisp autumn weather with colorful foliage; one of the most pleasant months to visit Philadelphia.
Cooling temperatures and shorter days signal the approach of winter; a medium-weight coat is advisable.
Cold winter month with festive holiday atmosphere; snow is possible and warm clothing is a must.
